title: E field - balance weight Mg and electric force QE

content.question: A small particle of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> has a negative charge <math alttext="negative Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and is in equilibrium a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> above the surface of Earth. There is a uniform electric field in the region of space around the particle. What is the magnitude of the electric field?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction M lowercase g over Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>Q</mi></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator uppercase G M, and denominator D squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q, and denominator 4 times pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, D squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction M lowercase g over Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>Q</mi></mfrac></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
